Token.Abstract: MBAttributeValidator instances can be used to verify that a given MBDataModel contains an expected set of values.
Returns a new MBAttributeValidator to be used for validating the specified MBDataModel.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An MBAttributeValidator that can be used to validate model.

Token.Abstract: Returns the MBDataModel that the receiver was constructed to validate.
Returns the MBDataModel that the receiver was constructed to validate.
Returns the MBDataModel that the receiver was constructed to validate.
Returns an array of NSStrings containing error messages for any problems encountered during validation. Will be nil if no validation errors have occurred.
Returns an array of NSStrings containing error messages for any problems encountered during validation. Will be nil if no validation errors have occurred.
Returns an array of NSStrings containing error messages for any problems encountered during validation. Will be nil if no validation errors have occurred.
Requires that the data model contain either attr1 or attr2 but not both.

Parameter.Name: attr1
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the first attribute.

Parameter.Name: attr2
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the second attribute.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the validation requirement was satisfied; NO otherwise.

Token.Abstract: Requires that the data model contain either attr1 or attr2.

Parameter.Name: attr1
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the first attribute.

Parameter.Name: attr2
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the second attribute.

Parameter.Name: onlyAllowOne
Parameter.Abstract: If YES, the requirement will be satisfied only if attr1 or attr2 exists but not both. If NO, the requirement will be satisfied if either attr1 or attr2 is present or if both are present.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the validation requirement was satisfied; NO otherwise.

Token.Abstract: Requires at least one of a set of attribute names to be present in the data model. Validation will fail if none of the specified attributes are present.

Parameter.Name: attrs
Parameter.Abstract: An enumeration of NSStrings representing the attribute names to validate.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the validation requirement was satisfied; NO otherwise.

Token.Abstract: Requires exactly one of a set of attribute names to be present in the data model. Validation will fail if none of the specified attributes are present, or if more than one is present.

Parameter.Name: attrs
Parameter.Abstract: An enumeration of NSStrings representing the attribute names to validate.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the validation requirement was satisfied; NO otherwise.

Token.Abstract: Returns YES if all validation requirements were satisfied.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if validation succeeded; NO otherwise.
